text: we have some breaking news to bring to
you the the rapper ASAP rocky has been
found guilty of assault in Stockholm the
Swedish Court says the victim in the
case will be awarded damages the rapper
whose real name is rocky Meyers was
accused of assaulting a teenager in the
city in June we can go now live to our
correspondent Madi savage in Stockholm
Madi tell us more about this outcome
well the judgement was handed out in
paper copies to journalists also sent to
some of us by email ASAP rocky and two
others who were on trial
guilty of assault here in the Swedish
capital at the end of June the judgement
confirmed that the court did believe
that ASA
rocky and the two others with him had
kicked and punched the alleged victim
the victim and pushed him to the ground
but crucially there was a lot of
argument during the trial about whether
or not bottles had been used the
judgement said it could not confirm
whether or not that had been the case
but it still deemed this a serious
enough incident for the group to be
given a guilty verdict they will not
however be asked to return to Sweden to
spend any more time in prison they spent
a month in custody in a detention centre
ahead of the trial and essentially
they've been given what's called as
conditional sentence here in Sweden
that's a suspended sentence which means
that the court believes that they've
already spent enough time in custody and
they do not have to return so certainly
not the not guilty verdict that the
rapper will have been hoping for but a
lot of his fans will be pleased to see
that he will remain free in the outside
world and will not have to return to
custody and Madi just briefly one of the
reasons that there's so much attention
on this case is the high-profile
supporters he was having yes that one
month in detention sparked a lot of
attention around the world because
people including the US president Donald
Trump also celebrities like Kanye West
in kardashian-west justin beiber they
believed that he should be freed while
he awaited the trial in other words bail
that he should be able to pay his way
out but that's not how the justice
system works in Sweden anyone who's
considered a flight risk is typically
held in custody pending a trial of this
kind so that's why a lot of media came
here to cover the trial far fewer
journalists here today not so many fans
but the ones who were gathered outside
when the verdict came in certainly
seemed very pleased with the outcome in
terms of the fact that a set rocket no
longer has to spend any more time behind
bars Madi savage' live in Stockholm
thanks very much
